distorCont.rpOrgName: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

onLineSrc.orDesc: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Assessors parcel data for Town/City of SOMERSET. Developed from existing digital data.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Original map compilation and maintenance done by the Town of Somerset. MassGIS Level 3 compliance obtained by Cartographic Associates, Inc. Current maintenance being done by Hilltop Northeast Enterprises, LLC.

LegConsts.useLimit: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.
LegConsts.othConsts: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis

Consts.useLimit: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: Data is for Assessing and plannig purposes only. Parcel are current as of December 31,2023

report.measDesc: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public rights-of-way (ROWs) exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

prcStep.stepDesc: Parcel polygons and water, wetland and ROW lines converted with ESRI tools to project, dissolve, copy, calculate, and generally manipulate the ESRI version of the data to meet Mass GIS Level III standards. The source data is not changed by this process.

dataSource.srcDesc: This GIS dataset represents a digital version of assessor tax maps that were previously converted and processed into a geodatbase/shapefile format.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.dsoverv: M273TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of SOMERSET that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M273Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M273OthLeg and M273Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http:/ /www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.
overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1.
http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/standards/standard-parcels.html
